crypto.name: Larisa
crypto.desc: In our Larisa challenge first decrypt a mysterious cipher, unraveling hidden messages, and prove your cryptographic prowess in this ASIS CTF task.

crypto.name: M7P
crypto.desc: Now for M7P challenge try to crack the given enigma, decode complex algorithms, and showcase your cryptographic skills in this thrilling CTF crypto task.

crypto.name: Sony
crypto.desc: Navigate the intricate realm of sony, a challenging cryptography task blending creativity with modern approaches for a rewarding CTF.

crypto.name: Tapernous
crypto.desc: Embark on Tapernous, a small yet creative cryptography challenge, employing semi-modern methods, promising a uniquely enriching CTF experience.

crypto.name: Tricare
crypto.desc: The tricare cryptosystem, reliant on exacting precision, safeguards information through a meticulous fusion of cryptography techniques and rigorous key management mechanisms.

forensic.name: White and Blank
forensic.desc: Dive into a vibrant and straightforward miscellaneous challenge White & Blank, tailored for enthusiasts exploring the intricacies of 🧡💛💚forensics🧡💛💚.

pwn.name: Text editor v2
pwn.desc:
Text editor is back!!

Additional detail: Author's script can exploit remote under 20 seconds ( with 100ms ping to the server )

pwn.name: isWebP.js
pwn.desc: Did you know that Javascript doesn't have an image validator by default? That's why I decided to implement something like isNaN for images (isPNG, isJpeg, isWebP). So far I've only implemented isWebP and I wanna do a beta test before submitting the proposal to ECMA. You can also test the feature via the address below. Can't wait for your feedbacks!

rev.name: Akin
rev.desc: Delve into a concise, inventive reverse engineering journey with Akin, exploring a novel CPU architecture in this intriguing challenge.

rev.name: Dadci
rev.desc: The ASIS CTF final introduces a challenging reverse engineering task called dadci. This intricate challenge pushes the limits of reverse engineering, presenting a formidable test in the final hours of 2023.

rev.name: Easy Risky
rev.desc: Commence on a quick adventure with easy risky, a super simple and tiny reverse engineering challenge designed as a warm-up exercise.

rev.name: Godzilla
rev.desc: The enigmatic Godzilla encryption employs esoteric binary techniques, confounding adversaries with its cryptic power and inscrutable intricacies. Can you break it?

rev.name: Noisyless
rev.desc: Dive into the intricate realm of noisyless, a super hard and complex reverse engineering challenge exclusively crafted for The_Bad_Gods.

rev.name: Solron
rev.desc: Embark on an exceptional journey through the intricacies of a compact reverse engineering challenge named Solron, highlighting innovative encoding techniques.

web.name: Pupptear
web.desc: Do you know what Puppeteer's friends call him when he cries? Pupptear... hahahaah

web.name: Sayeha
web.desc:
Shadows is back but you can't find anymore :?

Based on Shadows from Dicectf 2022.

web.name: Sayeha Revenge
web.desc:
the revenge of Sayeha

password is the flag of Sayeha

web.name: catfinder
web.desc: We keep a database of found cats ( cats themselves email us their names and addresses ). If you ever lost your cat (😢) you can try to search here. if you found their name in the database you can email us!

web.name: gimme csp
web.desc: hint for beginners: read about CSPs and Iframes and what features they can offer that you can use to bypass or exfiltrate things. The challenge isn't easy if you are new to CTFs or don't have much experience however it should be the easiest web challenge.
